Stand on two side rails when the treadmill starts; clip the safety key to your clothes to control any emergency.
Clip the safety key cord with your clothes.
Insert power plug and turn on; place safety key on console and clip to clothes; after screen displays, treadmill enters manual mode (P0); press START/PAUSE to begin workout.
The screen starts a 5-second countdown with 5 beeps; after countdown, the treadmill starts gently and accelerates slowly to the displayed speed.

Pull out the safety key or press the 'stop' button to stop the treadmill during exercise.
Console does not detect safety lock signal; check if safety key is in correct position; reinstall safety key socket; replace console
Pull off the safety key and then press the 'PROGRAM' and 'MODE' keys at the same time; display shows 0.6 for kilometers to miles, 1.0 for miles to kilometers.
36 automatic training programs
3 user-programmable profiles (U01-U03)
10 segments
In the running state of the treadmill, QUICK SPEED keys directly set the speed to the specified value of the key.
In the running state, QUICK INCLINE keys directly set the incline to the specified value of the key.
Distance and time are shown in the 'DISTANCE''TIME' window; calories in the 'CALORIES' window; incline in the 'INCLINE' window; pulse in the 'PULSE' window; speed in the 'SPEED' window.
The speed or incline adjustment is only valid in the current segment; when switching to a different segment, the setting resets and three beeps sound.
The motor stops automatically; a long stop prompt sound occurs
Press the START/PAUSE key to pause the treadmill during a run; press it again to resume without losing data.
ERP mode is the default power-saving mode; the console enters sleep state after about 4.5 minutes of no operation.
In standby mode, press and hold the MODE button for about 3 seconds to display '2222' to cancel ERP; long press again for about 3 seconds to display '1111' to return to ERP mode.
The console will display OIL after running 300 km; lubricate the belt as indicated, then press any key for 6 seconds to clear the warning and reset the distance.

Main frame; Motor mount; Foot link weldment (2); Right rotation fixed plate; Left rotation fixed plate; Step rotating fixed plate (2); Foot link fixing plate (2); Switch fixing plate; Left stand post; Right stand post; Monitor frame; Monitor bracket; Speed sensor; Incline frame; Filter; Controller; Inductance; Safety key; Plug socket; Incline motor; Rocker switch

Step 1: Turn out the foot folding rod from the underside of the running deck with your foot and lift the stand post; Step 2: Hold handle bar with one hand and pull up the monitor tray with the other; Step 3: Pull up the monitor to the right position for your preference; treadmill is now unfolded and ready to use.

Do not strike after standing up.
Cut off the power before moving the treadmill.

Turn on power; press 'PROGRAM' to select an automatic program (P1-P36); press 'Start' to begin; treadmill runs automatically according to selected mode.
Yes; press the speed quick key to quickly enter the running speed you need while running.
After the motor stops, incline the treadmill to a certain height and adjust the rear feet pad; adjustable in two gears.
Place your hands on the handle pulse cables to read heart rate.
No; heart-rate readings are for sports reference only, not medical use
Stop exercising immediately; lay down on the ground until you feel better.
No; keep children away from the treadmill to avoid any accident.
No; only one person at a time is allowed to use the treadmill
Outdoor use is not allowed
Pull out the plug when meet with power failure suddenly, may cause accident and injury when power resumption.
Turn off the power; pull out the plug gently from the socket; hold the plug, not the wire, when pulling out the plug; do not pull out or insert the plug with wet hands.
Do not open motor and roller cover unless professionals.
Do not use the treadmill after meals or when tired; may cause damage to your health.
The treadmill is intended for home use; it cannot be used in school or gymnasium where there are lots of unspecific users.

Patients under treatment for backache, leg/waist/neck injuries, numbness, chronic diseases (intervertebral disc protrusion, spinal slip, cervical vertebra protrusion), deformational arthritis, rheumatism, gout, osteoporosis, circulatory system issues (heart disease, vascular disorders, hypertension), respiratory disturbance, artificial heart rhythm problems, malignant tumors, thrombosis, diabetes with perceptual disturbance, skin injury, high fever above 38°C, bent backbone, pregnancy or menstrual period, discomfort, poor condition, rehabilitation purposes, abnormal physical features; consult a doctor before use.
Press the PROGRAM key to select BMI; press MODE to select item number; use + and - to set parameters; after setting, hold hands on heart rate sensors for 4 seconds to display body fat percentage.
F1: Sex; range 1-2; 1=male, 2=female. F2: Age; range 1-99 years. F3: Height; range 100-220CM (39-87inch). F4: Weight; range 20-150KG (44-330lb).
BMI less than 18 is underweight; 18-24 is ideal; 25-28 is overweight; greater than 29 is obese (Asian standard)
Turn off the power and pull out the plug when you finish exercising.

Pressing STOP during running stops the motor from running.

10 segments per P1–P36 workout

Ensure the treadmill is stable on the ground; check if its function is normal before running.

Keep power cord away from hot objects; do not damage or twist the power cord; do not put heavy things on it; do not operate with wet hands; do not pull out or insert the plug with wet hands; hold the plug not the wire when pulling out; keep the power plug away from needle, waste or water.
Stop using immediately; pull out the plug; make a trouble call, may cause electric shock and injury.
Anyrun; Kinomap; Zwift

Turn on device Bluetooth; log in to Anyrun APP; go to Settings > Device Management; find and click the device Bluetooth name; system connects automatically; console displays Bluetooth connection symbol when successful.

Login Zwift APP on mobile; select running speed in running on the matching device page; click Matching; select SW-XXXXXX-XXXX (the number on the console) on the search page and press OK; select YOUR SPEED on the 'What's YOUR SPEED' page and press OK; select the route, training, or other Zwifters, and click 'Run' after setting; console synchronizes data with Zwift when it enters movement; Bluetooth cannot be connected under engineering mode.
Bluetooth cannot be connected to the console under the page of engineering mode.
Turn on Bluetooth on your smartphone; select 'RUN MUSIC' in Bluetooth settings; connect to 'RUN MUSIC'; once connected, you can play music via Bluetooth.
Use 8 mm wrench to turn left belt tension bolt clockwise 1/4 turn; repeat for right bolt; turn both bolts same number of turns; repeat until slipping stops; do not overtighten.
Turn both belt tension bolts counter-clockwise the same number of turns.

Start treadmill without anyone on it; increase speed to 6 km/h; observe belt position; if left, turn left adjustment bolt clockwise 1/4 turn and right bolt counterclockwise 1/4 turn; if right, turn right adjustment bolt clockwise 1/4 turn and left bolt counterclockwise 1/4 turn; repeat until centered; increase speed to 13 km/h to verify; repeat if necessary.
13 kph
NOT_FOUND

Position belt seam in middle; insert spray valve in lubricant container; lift belt at one side, spray from front to back; repeat on other side; spray each side ~4 seconds; wait 1 minute before starting machine.

Wipe the console and other surfaces with a clean soft and damp cloth to remove sweat residues; do not use abrasives or solvents; keep liquids away from the computer; do not expose the computer to direct sunlight.

Place the treadmill indoors; do not use or store it outdoors, near bathrooms, in direct sunlight, or high temperature places; keep away from water, dust, and dampness; pull out the plug when not using.
Check and reconnect the speed sensor; replace the speed sensor if defective; clean dust or grease on speed sensor; replace the controller if needed.
Reconnect the communication cable and check if the terminal is connected well or replace the communication cable; replace the console; replace the controller

E-02 indicates defective motor cable and motor; resolve by replacing the motor; or poor connection between motor cable and controller or defective controller; resolve by checking and connecting cables well or replacing the controller.
E-05 indicates: A, Controller is damaged; B, damaged motor; C, mechanical failure (check whether the silicon oil backside of running belt is dry or rollers was blocked)
Check and connect or replace the handle pulse cables; Replace the console if monitor cables are defective
Press any key to wake up the system from ERP sleep.
Support the handle bar to push up and leave running belt; stop the machine and cut the power immediately; consult after-sales service if needed
Do not jump up or down from the treadmill when running; may fall down and get injury.
Reserve the silicon bottle to some place that children cannot reach
Do not operate with wet hands; may cause electric shock or injury.
Disassemble, repair, change by customer themselves are forbid absolutely; may cause mechanical breakdown and injury.
Turn off the power before folding the unit.
Connect the power plug to a socket with a grounded circuit; the socket must have a special circuit not shared with other electrical equipment; ensure the treadmill is stable on the ground before use.
Keep less indoor dust and a certain extent of humidity to avoid interference of console and controller.

Connect the power or turn the power switch to the 'NO' position; put the safety key in the correct position; replace the controller or monitor if there is no power to them; check system input and output cable terminals and communication cables inside stand post for poor cable connection.
Press any key for 6 seconds to clear the warning and reset the distance until the next lubrication.
